com.mr.moviecatalogue.service

Class MovieCatalogueService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mr.moviecatalogue.service.MovieCatalogueService

  • @Component
public class MovieCatalogueService
extends java.lang.Object
    This Service class handles the logic of the catalogue application, ensuring ratings stored in the database are valid and processing null ratings which cannot be stored in the SQL database, and also rounding all ratings to one decimal place (always rounding down).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MovieCatalogueService() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDirector(DirectorIO directorIO)
      Adds the director to all the given movies in the DirectorIO argument.
      void addMovie(MovieIO movieIO)
      Throws an IllegalArgumentException for ratings outside the range of 0.0 - 5.0 and rounds the given rating to one decimal place, or sets the rating to -1.0 if the rating in the MovieIO is null, and calls the database service to store the movie in the database
      void deleteDirector(java.lang.String director)
      Calls database service to delete the director value for all movies with the given director
      void deleteDirectorFromMovie(java.lang.String title)
      Calls the database service to see if there is a movie stored for the given title, and if so, calls the database service to delete the director for it
      void deleteMovie(java.lang.String title)
      Calls the database service to see if there is a movie stored for the given title, and if so, calls the database service to delete the movie
      void deleteRatingFromMovie(java.lang.String title)
      Calls the database service to see if there is a movie stored for the given title, and if so, calls the database service to update the rating to -1.0 which is being used for null ratings in the database
      void editMovie(java.lang.String title, MovieIO movieIO)
      Verifies that there is a movie in the database with the given title to edit.
      Catalogue getCurrentCatalogue()
      Calls the database and returns a Catalogue containing all the movies stored in the database
      Catalogue getMovieByTitle(java.lang.String title)
      Calls the database service to get the movie with the given title from the database and sets it in the Catalogue if there is a movie with the title.
      Catalogue getMoviesAboveRating(java.lang.Float rating)
      Checks the given rating is within the acceptable range of 0.0-5.0 and throws an IllegalArgumentException if not.
      Catalogue getMoviesByDirector(java.lang.String director)
      Calls the database service to search for movies with the given director and returns them in a Catalogue
      Catalogue getMoviesByDirectorAboveRating(java.lang.String director, java.lang.Float rating)
      This method throws an IllegalArgumentException for ratings outside the range of 0.0 - 5.0, rounds the given rating to one decimal place and then calls the database service with the given director and rating

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovieCatalogueService

        public MovieCatalogueService()

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentCatalogue

        public Catalogue getCurrentCatalogue()
        Calls the database and returns a Catalogue containing all the movies stored in the database
        Returns:
        Returns the full current catalogue of movies

      • addMovie

        public void addMovie(MovieIO movieIO)
        Throws an IllegalArgumentException for ratings outside the range of 0.0 - 5.0 and rounds the given rating to one decimal place, or sets the rating to -1.0 if the rating in the MovieIO is null, and calls the database service to store the movie in the database
        Parameters:
        movieIO - MovieIO containing mandatory title field and optional director and rating fields
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if rating is outside of acceptable range

      • addDirector

        public void addDirector(DirectorIO directorIO)
        Adds the director to all the given movies in the DirectorIO argument. First checks the full list of titles to ensure they are all in the database, throwing an IllegalArgumentException if one is not, and then calls the database service to update the director for each movie in the database
        Parameters:
        directorIO - DirectorIO containing the name of the director to add and a list of movie titles to add the director to
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if any of the movies in the DirectorIO are not present in the database

      • editMovie

        public void editMovie(java.lang.String title,
                      MovieIO movieIO)
        Verifies that there is a movie in the database with the given title to edit. Then conditionally updates the movie in the database based on which fields are set in the MovieIO and whether they already match the values stored in the database for the given movie. Throws an IllegalArgumentException for ratings outside the range of 0.0 - 5.0, and rounds the given rating to one decimal place. Also throws an IllegalArgumentException if there is no movie present in the database with the given title.
        Parameters:
        title - Current title of movie to be edited
        movieIO - MovieIO containing optional fields, which if set, will be updated in the given movie
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if rating is outside of acceptable range, or if movie is not present in database for given title

      • getMoviesByDirector

        public Catalogue getMoviesByDirector(java.lang.String director)
        Calls the database service to search for movies with the given director and returns them in a Catalogue
        Parameters:
        director - Name of director to be searched for
        Returns:
        A Catalogue with the movies with the given director

      • getMoviesAboveRating

        public Catalogue getMoviesAboveRating(java.lang.Float rating)
        Checks the given rating is within the acceptable range of 0.0-5.0 and throws an IllegalArgumentException if not. Then rounds the rating to 1 decimal place, and calls the database service to search for movies with the given rating and returns them in a Catalogue
        Parameters:
        rating - Rating above which movies will be searched for in database. Must be within range 0.0-5.0 and will be rounded down to 1 decimal place
        Returns:
        A Catalogue containing all the movies with a rating equal to or above the given rating
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if rating is outside of acceptable range

      • getMovieByTitle

        public Catalogue getMovieByTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Calls the database service to get the movie with the given title from the database and sets it in the Catalogue if there is a movie with the title. Otherwise, sets an empty HashMap in the Catalogue and returns it.
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the movie to be retrieved from Database
        Returns:
        A Catalogue containing the movie with the given title

      • getMoviesByDirectorAboveRating

        public Catalogue getMoviesByDirectorAboveRating(java.lang.String director,
                                                java.lang.Float rating)
        This method throws an IllegalArgumentException for ratings outside the range of 0.0 - 5.0, rounds the given rating to one decimal place and then calls the database service with the given director and rating
        Parameters:
        director - Name of director to be filtered by
        rating - Rating to filter for movies above. Must be between 0.0-5.0 and will be rounded down to 1 decimal place
        Returns:
        A Catalogue containing all movies by the given director above the given rating
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if rating is outside of acceptable range

      • deleteDirectorFromMovie

        public void deleteDirectorFromMovie(java.lang.String title)
        Calls the database service to see if there is a movie stored for the given title, and if so, calls the database service to delete the director for it
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the movie to have its director deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if movie is not returned from database for given title

      • deleteRatingFromMovie

        public void deleteRatingFromMovie(java.lang.String title)
        Calls the database service to see if there is a movie stored for the given title, and if so, calls the database service to update the rating to -1.0 which is being used for null ratings in the database
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the movie to have its rating deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if movie is not returned from database for given title

      • deleteMovie

        public void deleteMovie(java.lang.String title)
        Calls the database service to see if there is a movie stored for the given title, and if so, calls the database service to delete the movie
        Parameters:
        title - Title of the movie to be deleted
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if movie is not returned from database for given title

      • deleteDirector

        public void deleteDirector(java.lang.String director)
        Calls database service to delete the director value for all movies with the given director
        Parameters:
        director - Name of database to be deleted from database
